title: 109_hr666
content: The Act titled "Servicemembers' Family Protection Act of 2005" allows for an allowance to cover monthly deductions from basic pay for Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance coverage for members serving in Iraq or Afghanistan. The Act "Servicemembers' Family Protection Act of 2005" provides an allowance to cover monthly deductions from basic pay for Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance coverage for members serving in Iraq or Afghanistan. This includes reimbursement for premium deductions for members serving in these locations. The Act "Servicemembers' Family Protection Act of 2005" provides an allowance for members insured under the Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance program. Members deployed to Iraq or Afghanistan can receive information about the allowance and additional coverage options. The table of sections in chapter 7 of title 37, United States Code, is amended by adding a new item. Section 437 of title 37, United States Code, allows for an allowance to cover monthly deductions from basic pay for Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance for members serving in Iraq or Afghanistan. This section applies to service in these countries for months beginning on or after the enactment of this Act. The Secretary of Defense must notify members in Iraq or Afghanistan about the availability of the allowance for insured members and the option for uninsured members to elect coverage. Members who choose not to be insured under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance or elect less than the maximum coverage can still obtain additional coverage as provided in section 1967(c) of title 38, United States Code. DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE PAYMENT TO MEMBERS WHO DIED WHILE SERVING IN IRAQ OR AFGHANISTAN WITHOUT FULL SERVICEMEMBERS' GROUP LIFE INSURANCE COVERAGE. The Secretary of Defense will make payments for members of the Armed Forces who died as a result of injuries sustained while serving in Iraq or Afghanistan, and were not fully insured under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance. The payment amount will be the difference between $250,000 and their insurance coverage level. The Secretary of Defense will make payments to beneficiaries of deceased Armed Forces members who were not fully insured under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance. The payment amount will be the difference between $250,000 and any insurance paid on behalf of the member.
